alert.note: Alert for Ferry (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 15 at 3:53AM PDT until May 20 at 7:13PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Washington... Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew affecting Ferry County. Stehekin River at Stehekin affecting Chelan County. .Warm temperatures for the upcoming week will melt high mountain snowpack and result in increased river flows. For the Kettle River...including Ferry above Curlew...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 18.5 feet, Flooding begins on Customs Road near mile post 6. At 19.0 feet, Flooding at Beal Park on West Kettle River Road, west of Curlew. `Ol Swimming Hole Park in Curlew will be inundated. Flooding of yards and outbuildings along the river from the Canadian border through Curlew on both sides of the river. Some driveways on Kettle River Road will be flooded. Water will be over Customs Road near Riverview Lane and between milepost 5 and 6. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:15 PM PDT Sunday the stage was 17.8 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 18.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 500 PM PDT.
